title: Swiatek wins Wimbledon 6-0, 6-0 in 1st since 1911
content: Iga Swiatek needed just 57 minutes to earn her first Wimbledon title and sixth major championship, overwhelming American Amanda Anisimova 6-0, 6-0 on Saturday in the women's final.

title: Longtime standout DT Suh announces retirement
content: Ndamukong Suh announced his retirement from the NFL on Saturday, issuing a heartfelt statement on the first anniversary of his father's death.

title: Red Sox P Dobbins (ACL) out remainder of season
content: Red Sox righty Hunter Dobbins tore his right ACL Friday night and will miss the remainder of the season.

title: Trinity OC's 8-year-old daughter dies in TX floods
content: Trinity University said on Friday that 8-year-old Kellyanne Lytal, the daughter of Tigers offensive coordinator Wade Lytal, was confirmed dead after being missing since the Guadalupe River floods hit Texas last week.

title: Auburn star Pettiford arrested on charge of DUI
content: Auburn basketball player Tahaad Pettiford was arrested early Saturday morning in Lee County, Alabama, on a DUI charge.

title: USMNT star Tillman joins Leverkusen from PSV
content: United States men's national team midfielder Malik Tillman has completed a move to Bayer Leverkusen, the club announced Saturday.

title: Fever bounce back behind 'floor general' Clark
content: The Fever got back on track Friday against the Dream despite another poor shooting effort from Caitlin Clark, who still keyed Indiana's offense with her playmaking.

title: QB Retzlaff announces his withdrawal from BYU
content: Jake Retzlaff announced on Friday that he's withdrawing from BYU, formally initiating his transfer process from the school.

title: How Iga Swiatek defied all expectations to win her first Wimbledon title
content: After an early exit at her favorite Slam last month, Swiatek rebounded on her worst surface to take the Wimbledon title.

title: The players we can't wait to see in the MLB Futures Game
content: The brightest stars in the minors take the field today in Atlanta. Here's who Kiley McDaniel is watching most closely.

title: LeBron to Luka: Inside the most delicate superstar transition in NBA history
content: For months, publicly and privately, the Lakers have been signaling their desire to begin the Luka Doncic era in Los Angeles, even if it meant ending the LeBron James one.

title: Who are the NFL's best interior offensive linemen? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Execs, coaches and scouts from around the NFL ranked their top 10 interior offensive linemen in our annual summer series.

title: Sinner vs. Alcaraz: Who will win the Wimbledon title?
content: Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner will face off for the second time in a major final, at Wimbledon on Sunday. Our experts make predictions.

title: Transfer rumors, news: USMNT's Pulisic wanted by Ronaldo's Al Nassr
content: Al Nassr are looking at a summer move for AC Milan's United States star Christian Pulisic. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Tillman to Leverkusen: Can USMNT star fill void left by Wirtz?
content: Malik Tillman is coming off a career year and Bayer Leverkusen are in transition. Is this a perfect match?

title: Why the NFLPA mess should matter to football fans
content: It behooves the competitive balance of the NFL to have strong ownership and strong labor, Wetzel writes.

title: MLB mock draft 3.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first two rounds
content: The MLB draft is Sunday! And this year, the drama starts with the Washington Nationals at the No. 1 pick.

title: How Chelsea, PSG compare; who will win?
content: One of Chelsea or PSG will win the first expanded Club World Cup on Sunday, so how do they match up ahead of the final?

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Italy run Spain close to qualify; Portugal fall
content: Italy put in a great performance despite losing to Spain to seal the second qualification spot in Group B. Here's everything you need to know about Euro 2025 action.

title: Liverpool retire No. 20 jersey in memory of Jota
content: Liverpool have confirmed they will retire the No. 20 shirt in honour of forward Diogo Jota, who died in a car crash alongside brother André Silva last week.

title: PSG's 'team of stars' look to cap historic season
content: Luis Enrique said Paris Saint-Germain's "team of stars" can deliver the "icing on the cake" for their incredible season in the FIFA Club World Cup final.

title: Palace out of Europa League amid Lyon conflict
content: Crystal Palace have been demoted from the Europa League to the Conference League after UEFA's Club Financial Control Body ruled the Premier League club was too closely linked to Lyon.

title: Garber: CWC a milestone moment for U.S. soccer
content: As the Club World Cup draws to a close on Sunday, North America's soccer community is celebrating what Major League Soccer Commissioner Don Garber calls a breakthrough moment for the region.

title: Sources: Forest complain over Spurs MGW move
content: Nottingham Forest are set to complain to the Premier League over Tottenham Hotspur's move for Morgan Gibbs-White with the deal now on hold, sources have told ESPN.

title: Chelsea's Enzo: Heat at CWC 'very dangerous'
content: Chelsea's Enzo Fernández has said the playing conditions at the Club World Cup are "very dangerous" and urged FIFA to "change the schedule" at the 2026 World Cup to avoid putting players at risk in the tournament next year.

title: Perfect Spain top group as Italy also progress
content: Spain cruised to a 3-1 win over Italy on Friday that sees both sides through to the knockout stages at the Women's Euros.

title: Sources: Madueke leaves for Arsenal medical
content: Noni Madueke has left the Chelsea camp ahead of a proposed £50 million transfer to Arsenal, sources told ESPN.

title: The NBA is closing in on its first $1 million per game player
content: The reigning MVP will get close, but the league is still waiting for its first $82 million per year player.

title: The unstoppable power of Jim Abbott's legacy
content: Abbott, who pitched in the majors with one hand, remains a beacon for families with unique struggles.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Former heavyweight title contender Derrick Lewis is back
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? MMA analysts and former UFC fighters Anthony Smith and Din Thomas make their picks.

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: Video: IAS Officer Slaps Student Repeatedly During Exam In Madhya Pradesh
content: A government official was seen slapping a student multiple times during an exam in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district. The video from April 1 has now gone viral on social media.

title: 3 Killed, 2 Injured In Lightning Strike In Odisha: Police
content: At least three persons, including two women, were killed and two others were seriously injured in a lightning strike in Odisha's Balasore district on Saturday, police said.

title: Lieutenant Governor's Administration Denies Permission To J&K Parties' Martyrs' Day Request
content: The Lieutenant Governor's administration in Jammu and Kashmir has denied permission to all political parties, including the ruling National Conference, to attend July 13 Martyrs' Day function in Srinagar on Sunday.

title: First, Final Plane Crash Reports Different In Most Cases: Ex Probe Body Head
content: Aurobindo Handa, a former director general of the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) has cautioned that the initial findings of aircraft crash investigations and the final findings are different in most cases.

title: Delhi To Waive Late Fee On Water Bills As Dues Cross Rs 1.42 Lakh Crore
content: In a major relief measure for Delhi residents, the government is preparing to waive 100 per cent of the late payment surcharge on pending domestic water bills.

title: Iranian Embassy Flags Fake Social Media Accounts Undermining India-Iran Relations
content: The Iranian Embassy in New Delhi has issued a stern warning about a series of fake social media accounts impersonating official Iranian entities, allegedly aiming to disrupt the diplomatic relationship between Iran and India.

title: Actor Stabbed By Husband Over Suspected Affair In Bengaluru, Hospitalised
content: A shocking incident has come to light from Bengaluru where a Kannada TV actor and anchor, Manjula Shruthi, was stabbed by her husband over suspicion of infidelity.

title: Gingee Fort Joins UNESCO Heritage List As Part Of Maratha Military Landscapes
content: Tamil Nadu's historic Gingee Fort, often hailed as the "Troy of the East", has received global recognition, being inscribed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site under the Maratha Military Landscapes of India.

title: "Doesn't Talk...": Air India Crash Survivor Struggles To Overcome Trauma
content: Many would think of him as one of the luckiest persons alive in the world. But for Vishwas Kumar Ramesh, the sole survivor of the June 12 Air India plane crash, it has been a struggle to get over the monumental tragedy.

title: Air India Plane Crash Victims' Families Left With More Questions After Report
content: The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau released a preliminary report on its probe into the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad, Friday night. 241 people onboard the aircraft were killed, with only one survivor.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Meet India's First Fully Home-Grown AI+ Smartphone
content: India now has its first-ever, wholly Made-in-India smartphone. This device is designed, engineered, and governed entirely in India.

title: Trump Ramps Up Trade War, Slaps 30% Tariffs On European Union, Mexico
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday announced he's levying tariffs of 30 per cent against the European Union and Mexico.

title: 'No Rape, She Fell Out Of Auto': Father Of Woman 'Assaulted' At IIM Calcutta
content: The father of the woman who was allegedly raped at the Indian Institute of Management, Calcutta, has denied that anything of the sort happened and said his daughter fell out of an auto rickshaw.

title: Fresh Spell Of Rain Lashes Parts Of Delhi, Nearby Areas
content: Delhi experienced a fresh spell of rain on Saturday, just two days after experiencing extensive waterlogging in several parts of the national capital.

title: Teacher Asks For Sexual Favours, Student Sets Herself Ablaze In Odisha
content: Harassed by her head of department. who allegedly repeatedly asked her for sexual favours and threatened to destroy her future if she did not comply, a student set herself ablaze at a college in Odisha's Balasore

title: Man, 21, Arrested For Raping 4-Year-Old In Karnataka
content: A 21-year-old man has been arrested for raping a four-year-old in Karnataka's Mandya, said the police.

title: Columbia University To Possibly Pay $200 Million In Settlement With Trump Administration: Report
content: Columbia University has potentially agreed to pay hundreds of millions of dollars to settle the matter with the Trump administration. The matter was regarding allegations that the University failed to protect Jewish students from harassment.

title: "Avoid Speculation...": IIM Calcutta After Alleged Rape Incident On Campus
content: After an alleged rape incident on the campus, IIM Calcutta on Saturday said that the institute has zero tolerance for such incidents and remains steadfast in upholding a safe and respectful campus environment.

title: "Was Advisory, Not Mandatory": Air India On US Report On Fuel Control Switch
content: Fuel control switches to the engines of an Air India flight that crashed shortly after takeoff, killing 260 people, were moved from the "run" to the "cutoff" position moments before impact, a preliminary investigation report said early Saturday.

title: Navi Mumbai Airport Must Be Completed By September 30: Devendra Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said on Saturday that works on the Navi Mumbai International Airport must be completed by September 30.

title: Air India crash: What AAIB report confirms, what it rules out, what still remains unanswered
content: A preliminary report on the Air India Flight 171 crash in Ahmedabad reveals a dual engine failure caused by fuel cutoff switches being inexplicably moved. Cockpit recordings capture confusion among the pilots, with one denying responsibility. Despite engine restarts, the plane crashed shortly after takeoff.

title: 'Beyond understanding': NDA-ally Chirag sends new message to Nitish govt
content: Union Minister Chirag Paswan criticized Bihar's deteriorating law and order following a series of murders, including a hospital worker in Nalanda. Political tensions escalated as Congress leaders blamed the central government, while the ruling coalition pointed fingers at the opposition.

title: 'Show some f**ing b**s': Shubman Gill shouts at Zak Crawley
content: Day 3 of the India vs. England Test at Lord's was filled with drama. After India posted 387, Jasprit Bumrah's fiery spell against Zak Crawley ignited tensions, with Shubman Gill's outburst adding fuel. Sarcastic applause followed a blow to Crawley, intensifying the atmosphere.

title: 'Maine kanya vadh kar diya hai': What Radhika Yadav's father said after killing her
content: Deepak Yadav fatally shot his daughter, Radhika, a former tennis player, following disagreements over her coaching and career aspirations. He confessed to the crime, expressing remorse and a desire for punishment, citing societal pressures and disapproval of her earning money through tennis coaching as motives. The investigation continues, focusing on the father's objections, while dismissing other potential factors.

title: IND vs ENG, 3rd Test: Southee calls final-over controversy 'part of the game'
content: Tensions flared at Lord's as India and England concluded Day 3 of the third Test with identical first-innings scores. England's Tim Southee downplayed the drama, attributing it to the intensity of the series after Crawley clashed with Gill. With the series tied at 1-1, the match remains finely poised, promising more gripping cricket.

title: India-US trade deal: Will Trump go for less than 20% tariff rate for India? Top 10 developments
content: India and the US are edging closer to an interim trade agreement, potentially lowering tariffs to under 20%. Despite Trump's tariff threats and deadlines, India prioritizes national interests over timelines. While disagreements persist on agriculture and dairy, an Indian delegation will go to Washington for negotiations soon.

title: Student sets herself on fire after sexual harassment complaint goes unheard
content: In Odisha's Balasore, a college student self-immolated after alleging inaction on her sexual harassment complaint against a department head. Suffering 90% burns, she's now in critical condition at AIIMS Bhubaneswar. A student who tried to help was also injured. Prior to the incident, she protested for a week, and the college principal stated an internal inquiry was underway.

title: Twist in the tale? Big predictions for IND vs ENG at Lord's go viral
content: Dinesh Karthik and Stuart Broad presented contrasting views on the potential outcome of the Lord's Test. Karthik believes a result is likely, citing England's aggressive approach. He puts the chances at 50/50, dismissing a draw. Broad, however, favors a draw, arguing the pitch lacks the dynamism for a decisive session.

title: Microsoft layoffs: Company cuts 15,000 jobs; tells employees to invest in ...
content: Microsoft is urging its remaining workforce to enhance their AI skills after significant layoffs impacting over 15,000 employees this year. The company is integrating AI usage into performance reviews and shifting its sales strategy towards technically proficient "solutions engineers." This move comes amidst substantial AI investments and a company-wide push for Copilot adoption.

title: Op Sindoor showed India’s readiness; Pak’s weak China-made weapons exposed: US expert
content: Operation Sindoor served as a potent message to Pakistan and the world, showcasing India's military prowess and readiness, according to security expert John Spencer. The operation tested Indian-made systems against Chinese military technology used by Pakistan, revealing the ineffectiveness of the latter. This event highlighted India's strategic response to cross-border terrorism and its ongoing transformation in the defence sector

title: ‘Has a right’: Court clears ex-Kejriwal aide Bibhav Kumar’s Sri Lanka family vacation
content: A Delhi court has granted permission to Bibhav Kumar, former aide to Arvind Kejriwal, to travel to Sri Lanka for a family vacation from August 13-22. Kumar, accused of assaulting AAP MP Swati Maliwal, sought the trip for personal commitments. The court found no flight risk, noting his family duty and prior passport renewal approval.

title: Shaquille O’Neal settles $1.8m FTX suit; celeb crypto endorsements under fire
content: Shaquille O’Neal settled the FTX lawsuit. He paid $1.8 million. Tom Brady and Stephen Curry still face legal challenges. O’Neal's Instagram was hacked. Scammers targeted his followers. The hack was resolved quickly. Celebrities face risks from endorsements. Social media users should be careful of online scams. High-profile endorsements can lead to legal problems. O’Neal's settlement highlights digital trust issues.

title: Government on Chinese engineers leaving Indian iPhone factories: ‘Apple has alternatives…’
content: The Indian government is closely watching the departure of Chinese engineers from Foxconn, a major iPhone supplier, but believes Apple has solutions to maintain production. Despite concerns about potential disruptions to iPhone 17 production, Apple is increasing iPhone production in India, aiming for 60 million units this year, with eased component sourcing from China and government support through visa facilitation.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi flops? No worries — Captain Ayush Mhatre steps up with a century for India U-19 in Youth Test
content: Captain Ayush Mhatre's brilliant century powered India U-19 to a commanding 420 for 6 against England U-19 on the first day of the Youth Test. Mhatre's 102, along with Vihaan Malhotra's 67, laid a strong foundation. Abhigyan Kundu (90) and Rahul Kumar (85) further dominated the English bowlers with aggressive batting, propelling India to a formidable score.

title: Swiatek 6-0 in Grand Slam finals! Records broken during her Wimbledon rout of Anisimova
content: Iga Swiatek dominated Amanda Anisimova at Wimbledon, securing a historic 6-0, 6-0 victory in just 57 minutes. This win marks the most one-sided women’s final in 114 years and Swiatek's sixth Grand Slam title. The Polish star's triumph solidifies her place among tennis greats, achieving milestones like completing a career Grand Slam on all surfaces.

title: ‘Owed Rs 1.5 lakh’: Man steals transformer to dodge power cut over unpaid bills
content: In Bhind district, Shriram Bihari Tripathi allegedly stole an electricity transformer to avoid disconnection due to nearly Rs 1.5 lakh in unpaid bills. He dismantled the 25 kV transformer, which was meant for agricultural use, with his son's help and hid it at their residence. Police have registered a case and are working to recover the stolen equipment.

title: 'Friendship is done': Swift unlikely to forgive Blake Lively after betrayal
content: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively's friendship faces trouble. Sources say they are not in contact. This follows Lively's connection to Justin Baldoni's legal issues. Lively's image suffered, straining the bond. Swift is now focused on Travis Kelce. Lively seeks new high-profile connections. The friendship may be over. Both are moving on with their careers and relationships.

title: Gisele Bündchen’s tearful interview: Healing after Tom Brady divorce
content: Gisele Bundchen spoke about her divorce from Tom Brady in March 2024. She described it as the death of her dream. Bundchen dismissed media claims that Brady's return to football caused the split. She expressed continued support for Brady's happiness and success. Bundchen is focusing on her own truth and has grown close to Joaquim Valente.

title: Ayesha Curry melts hearts: baby Cai photo looks just like dad Stephen
content: Ayesha Curry recently shared a heartwarming photo of her youngest child, Cai, sparking a frenzy online due to the striking resemblance to his father, Steph Curry. Fans flooded social media, pointing out Cai's light eyes and infectious smile mirror those of the NBA superstar. Some even noted a resemblance to Steph's mother, Sonya Curry, highlighting the Curry family's strong genes.

title: Rahul & Pant partnership: A classy ton, a gritty knock, and a needless run
content: KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant scripted a brilliant 141-run partnership under pressure at Lord’s, showcasing composure and aggression. But a mix-up before lunch cost Pant his wicket and disrupted India’s momentum, though Rahul completed a century before falling on 100.

title: Bihar elections: INDIA bloc kicks off strategy meet; focus on seat allocation
content: INDIA bloc allies convened at Tejashwi Yadav's residence to strategize seat allocation for the upcoming Bihar assembly elections. Yadav, leading the coalition's coordination, criticized the NDA government for allegedly imitating his initiatives. Discussions included Congress, VIP, and Left party representatives, with seat-sharing and electoral roll revisions on the agenda. Mukesh Sahani hinted at his potential role as deputy chief minister.

title: Aaron Rodgers at war, clash with Steelers coaches called 'a mistake'
content: Hall of Famer Jerome Bettis is concerned about the Pittsburgh Steelers' potential identity shift after acquiring Aaron Rodgers and DK Metcalf. Bettis emphasizes the importance of maintaining a run-first approach, despite Rodgers' preference for a pass-heavy offense. The clash between Rodgers' style and offensive coordinator Arthur Smith's ground-focused scheme raises questions about the team's future success.

title: Wimbledon: Swiatek annihilates Anisimova 6-0, 6-0 to clinch first Grand Slam title on grass
content: Iga Swiatek dominated Amanda Anisimova to win her first Wimbledon title, securing her sixth Grand Slam crown. Swiatek's powerful performance on Centre Court showcased her mastery of grass, a surface she once found challenging. Anisimova, despite the loss, celebrated a remarkable comeback after a mental health break, reaching her first Grand Slam final.

title: EAM Jaishankar to visit China to attend SCO foreign ministers meet
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is scheduled to visit China for the SCO foreign ministers' meeting in Tianjin next week. The meeting will focus on SCO cooperation and significant international and regional matters. Bilateral discussions are expected to address ongoing normalisation efforts and China's halt on rare earth metals supply.

title: ALERT! Rishabh Pant breaks MS Dhoni's decade-long record
content: Rishabh Pant shines at Lord's, setting new records. He surpasses Vivian Richards for most sixes against England in Tests. Pant equals Rohit Sharma for second-most sixes by an Indian. He also beats MS Dhoni's record for most runs by an Indian wicketkeeper in an England Test series. Pant scores 74 despite a finger injury.

title: Cardiologist says this one risk factor for heart failure is rarely diagnosed
content: Heart failure, a leading cause of death in the US, can be triggered by cardiac amyloidosis, a condition often misdiagnosed as hypertension or age-related issues. A cardiologist highlights that amyloidosis involves protein infiltration stiffening the heart. Key indicators include thick heart walls, low EKG voltage, carpal tunnel, spinal stenosis, and unexplained fatigue, necessitating prompt medical consultation for accurate diagnosis. Read below!

title: US tariffs: Trump announces 30% duties for EU and Mexico
content: Donald Trump announced a 30% tariff on all goods imported from Mexico and the European Union, effective August 1, 2025. He cited Mexico's insufficient efforts to combat drug trafficking and persistent trade imbalances with the EU as justification. Trump suggested the tariffs could be avoided if companies relocate manufacturing to the United States, promising expedited approvals.

title: Top engineer quits Musk’s AI firm: Joins OpenAI; says ‘Jensen Huang was right, Elon & his teams…’
content: Uday Ruddarraju, xAI's head of infrastructure engineering, has resigned after a year, having been instrumental in building the Colossus supercomputer and training Grok 3. He expressed gratitude to Elon Musk and the xAI team for the experience. Shortly after his departure, Ruddarraju announced he is joining OpenAI, with OpenAI President Greg Brockman welcoming him and other engineers.

title: 'Bias towards pilot error': Pilots' association slams AI crash report
content: The Airline Pilots’ Association of India (ALPA) has voiced concerns over the AAIB's preliminary report on the Air India crash in Ahmedabad, suspecting bias towards pilot error and a lack of transparency. "The tone and direction of the investigation suggest a bias toward pilot error. We categorically reject this presumption and insist on a fair, fact-based inquiry," ALPA India president Sam Thomas said in a statement.

title: Visa expired in 2017: Russian woman, kids found in remote cave in Karnataka
content: A Russian woman, Nina Kutina, also known as Mohi, and her two young children were rescued from a cave in Karnataka's Ramatirtha hills. Mohi, drawn to Hinduism, had been living in isolation with her children, Preya and Ama, for about two weeks. Police discovered them during a patrol, revealing her visa expired in 2017.

title: ‘People questioned her character’: Father felt insulted — 15 days later, shot Radhika 4 times
content: Radhika Yadav, a tennis player, was murdered by her father, Deepak Yadav. The reason was disagreement over her tennis academy. Deepak was upset by comments about Radhika's character. He shot her multiple times at their house in Sector 57. Police investigation revealed Deepak's psychological issues. He was produced in court and is in police remand.

title: Russia launches over 620 drones and missiles; Zelenskyy demands sanctions
content: In a massive overnight aerial assault, Russia launched over 620 drones and missiles on Ukraine, resulting in casualties and widespread damage. President Zelenskyy has urged swift action against Russia, demanding sanctions on countries aiding Moscow. The strikes targeted regions from Kharkiv to Lviv, prompting retaliatory actions from Ukrainian forces.

title: IND vs PAK! Neeraj to face Arshad Nadeem for first time since 2024 Oly - details inside
content: India's Neeraj Chopra and Pakistan's Arshad Nadeem will compete at the Silesia Diamond League in Poland. This is their first meeting since the Paris Olympics 2024. Neeraj aims to improve his personal best. He is preparing for the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo. The competition between Neeraj and Arshad is highly anticipated by fans. It offers a glimpse of future contests.

title: ‘Unless you win...’: Amid Bihar voter list row, Khurshid downplays protest
content: Congress leader Salman Khurshid has differed with his party's stance on Bihar's voter list revision, emphasizing the importance of winning elections to make a difference. His remarks contrast with the Congress and RJD's criticism of the Election Commission, who allege manipulation by the BJP.

title: BJP govt report card: Delhi crime rate drops; enhanced surveillance credited
content: Delhi has witnessed a significant decrease in overall crime during the first half of 2025, following the Bharatiya Janata Party's assumption of administration. There's an 8.38% reduction in registered cases compared to 2024, with serious offenses like robbery and kidnapping also declining. Notably, rape and POSCO cases have seen a 10% decrease, alongside a drop in street crimes and burglaries.

title: Kohli’s adorable moment: Reply to ‘Where is Anushka?’ goes viral; fans gushing
content: Virat Kohli's adorable hand gestures explaining Anushka Sharma's absence at a London charity event charmed the internet. He indicated she was at home with their children, resting. This sweet moment follows their Wimbledon appearance and Anushka's earlier comments on their shared parenting duties, emphasizing a balanced approach to raising their child.

title: 'I wanted to live': Tiffany Mitchell recalls near-death ordeal
content: Tiffany Mitchell, a WNBA veteran, has signed with the Seattle Storm after a life-threatening battle with sepsis. The 30-year-old shooting guard's return to the court marks her tenth year in the WNBA. Mitchell's journey involved multiple hospital visits and severe symptoms, but she persevered, focusing on survival before returning to basketball.

title: India’s crewed space mission: Gaganyaan Propulsion System clears tests — Why this matters
content: Isro has successfully completed qualification tests for the Gaganyaan Service Module Propulsion System, a crucial step for India's first human spaceflight mission. The 350-second hot test validated the system's performance during emergency scenarios, ensuring astronaut safety. This achievement brings India closer to becoming the fourth nation to independently send humans into space, including Shubhanshu Shukla, currently on the ISS.

title: 'But she’s also a mama!' Ayesha Curry shares an adorable Instagram story
content: Ayesha Curry, entrepreneur and wife of Stephen Curry, balances her thriving career with family life. She recently celebrated her daughter Riley's 13th birthday, crafting a handmade pink blanket as a special gift. Despite a busy schedule promoting her brand, Sweet July, and enjoying family vacations, Ayesha ensures her children receive love and attention.

title: KL Rahul's wrong call costs Rishabh Pant a century; gutted Pant caught on camera in Lord's gallery
content: India faced a setback just before lunch on Day 3 of the third Test at Lord's as Rishabh Pant was run out after a significant 141-run partnership with KL Rahul. Ben Stokes's sharp fielding led to Pant's dismissal for 74, following a miscommunication with Rahul.

title: Fuel switches found in ‘RUN’ position: Aftermath of AI 171 crash in images; what wreckage shows
content: A preliminary report on the Air India AI 171 crash reveals a sudden fuel cutoff to both engines moments after takeoff from Ahmedabad. The London-bound Boeing 787, carrying a heavy load, failed to gain altitude, clipping structures before crashing into a building.

title: 'Lured with counselling session': Woman raped inside boys’ hostel of Kolkata B-school
content: A management student in Kolkata is under arrest. Paramanand Toppaunwar allegedly raped a female acquaintance. The incident occurred at the boys hostel inside the institute campus. The survivor claims she was invited for a counselling session. She alleges she was given a drink and then assaulted. Police are investigating the security lapses at the institute.

title: Switch on Kaleshwaram PHs to protect wilting crops: Harish
content: The BRS leader seeks to know from the govt. how Medigadda is handling over 8 lakh cusecs flood if it’s collapsed

title: Sivaganga custodial death: CBI registers FIR against police
content: Central agency files case under Section 103 (punishment for murder) of BNS; six police personnel of the special team that thrashed the youth were suspended and five among them were subsequently arrested by the State’s CB-CID

title: Maintain soft approach towards Nitish Kumar but target BJP leaders, Tejashwi tells INDIA bloc leaders
content: Latest round of INDIA bloc meeting held in Patna; after meeting, Mr. Yadav posted a message on his social media account saying the INDIA bloc talks were meaningful and positive

title: DMK will remain in power with absolute majority, says Vaiko
content: He say the question of a coalition government will not arise as the people of the State will not accept such an idea

title: The preliminary report on the AI 171 crash is notably brief and lacking in technical transparency, says aviation expert
content: The 33-page Ethiopian Airlines ET 302 preliminary report, for example, included extensive data traces, CVR excerpts, checklists, and manufacturer bulletins, enabling stakeholders worldwide to act swiftly, says Amit Singh, pilot and founder of the NGO Safety Matters

title: Enforcement Directorate attaches assets worth ₹762.47 crore in PACL case
content: ‘PACL misappropriated about ₹48,000 crore from investors through deceptive schemes’, according to the agency

title: Kolhapuri chappal row: Prada to launch capsule collection of ‘Made in India’ sandals with local artisans in Maharashtra
content: Prada to send technical expert team to the State next week, says Maharashtra Chamber of Commerce, Industry and Agriculture; describes it as a “significant win for community recognition and inclusion in global design platforms”

title: Debts increased under DMK regime: Edappadi K. Palaniswami
content: He says the DMK had availed itself of loan worth ₹5.38 lakh cr. ever since it assumed power, despite not having implemented any major projects

title: Congress welcomes Supreme Court order on proof of identity in Bihar SIR
content: These proofs of identity roughly covered 90% of the people who could be affected by the SIR exercise, said Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi, who also argued the case before the Supreme Court

title: UGC’s anti-ragging system has utterly failed, says Delhi High Court
content: Court mulls suo motu PIL petition to check the surge in ragging episodes and student suicides; UGC’s anti-ragging helpline recorded 1,084 complaints in 2024, the highest in nine years

title: Election Commission of India says 80% of electors in Bihar have submitted voter enumeration forms
content: The forms can be submitted till July 25 and the required documents are allowed till August 30, says poll panel in ongoing Special Intensive Revision

title: Over 1,500 Maoists have surrendered in Chhattisgarh in last 15 months, says Chief Minister
content: In a post on X, CM Vishnu Deo Sai says 1,521 Naxals have surrendered and called it ‘a strong indicator of the increasing reach and trust of the government in the Naxal-affected regions’

title: Odisha student battling for life following self-immolation, says sexual assault complaint against professor went unheard
content: Assistant professor Samir Kumar Sahu heading the education department in Fakir Mohan Autonomous College in Balasore district was arrested while principal of the college Dilip Ghosh was placed under suspension

title: Take active part in Special Intensive Revision, appeals Bihar Chief Electoral Officer
content: Expressing concern, the senior election officer said the participation of voters in urban areas was relatively lower than in rural areas

title: Amit Shah offers prayers at Rajarajeswara Temple amid tight security
content: After offering prayers at the temple, he returned to the airport by 6.45 p.m. and departed for New Delhi at 7.15 p.m

title: 500 issues in 44 years, a testament to a tiny magazine’s resilience, literary excellence
content: Writers and readers gather in Malappuram to celebrate Innu magazine’s journey, which began in 1981 and earned a Limca Record as India’s longest-running little magazine

title: ED attaches assets worth ₹681.54 crore in Ramprastha Promoters & Developers case
content: Projects such as Project Edge, Project Skyz, Project Rise, and Ramprastha City were launched between 2008 and 2011, but possession has not been handed over even after 14 to 17 years

title: Centre moves Supreme Court to review ruling on IPS deputation in CAPFs
content: Ministry seeks reconsideration of order directing phased reduction of IPS officers in senior CAPF posts within two years

title: Karnataka Congress needs more than holding OBC meet here to woo the communities to party, say activists
content: Setting aside the earlier caste census, apparently under pressure from the politically dominant Veerashaiva-Lingayats and Vokkaligas, is viewed as a failure of the Congress government’s OBC politics in Karnataka

title: Visit forts of Maratha Military Landscapes which made it to UNESCO list: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister urges Indians to visit UNESCO-listed Maratha forts, showcasing military strength and cultural pride

title: ED attaches assets worth ₹588.57 crore in Amtek Auto Limited case
content: Among the entities purportedly linked to the case are ARG Limited, ACIL Limited, Metalyst Forging Limited, and Castex Technologies Limited, along with promoter Arvind Dham and others.

title: Echoes of empowerment: ‘Penkaalangal’ resonates at National Percussion Festival
content: The second day of the percussion festival began with a stirring Panchari Melam performance led by Therozhi Ramakuruppu

title: Andhra Pradesh government is neglecting Srikakulam district, alleges Dharmana
content: Not even ₹1,000 crore has been allocated for pending irrigation and development projects in the district, he says

title: Trailblazer in ghatam now hears beats of success
content: India’s first woman ghatam maestro Sukanya Ramgopal recalls her rebellious journey. In the process, she pulled the instrument out of the shadows.

title: A shot in the dark
content: Industrialist Gopal Khemka was shot dead in Patna, seven years after the family lost a son — also to murder. As the family grieves, politics is at play with Opposition members and others from the NDA that the Chief Minister is a part of, lashing out at the Bihar government over deteriorating law and order, finds Amit Bhelari

title: Ramadoss tells cadre he’s the boss; Anbumani asks them to intensify membership drive
content: Ahead of the PMK stepping into its 37th year and celebrating its founding day on July 16, both leaders are wooing the cadre, hoping that they will decisively mobilise behind them and end the current leadership tussle

title: Officials deploy NDRF and SDRF teams in Eluru district as Godavari river swells
content: Over 900 families impacted as floodwaters rise; evacuation from cut-off villages ordered due to overflowing Yeddu Vaagu, says Jangareddygudem RDO

title: CPI demands disbanding of NTA, reforms in wildlife law
content: Resolution passed at the four-day district conference of the party at Irinjalakuda condemned repeated irregularities and alleged large-scale corruption in exams conducted by the NTA, claiming that the agency operated with no transparency or accountability

title: Startup demonstrates delivery of goods by large cargo drone in Tiruchi school
content: The drone, powered by an onboard battery and a payload of 6 kg, soared high at a speed of 100 km. It is developed by Amber Wings, an entity of The ePlane Company, the start-up incubated by IIT-M

title: Parking of trucks along service lanes goes unchecked
content: With the inauguration of the truck terminal at Panjapur near the integrated bus terminus at a cost of ₹110 crore to accommodate around 250 trucks with facilities, the random roadside parking is expected to come down

title: KMC chief focuses on sanitation
content: Instructs officials to complete pending repair works at the earliest and ensure drinking water is provided in the city

title: Over 420 pregnant women shifted to hospitals as Sabari and Godavari Rivers rise in Chintoor Agency in ASR district
content: Relief camps have been finalised, and medical and health staff will be deployed across all hospitals, including Primary Health Centres, says ITDA Project Officer

title: Enrolment in third phase clinical trials for India’s first dengue vaccine nearly complete, says ICMR
content: There is currently no antiviral treatment or licensed vaccine for dengue in India, which ranks among the top 30 countries with the highest incidence of the disease

title: Missing building numbers in K-Smart continue to trouble taxpayers
content: Taxpayers unable to pay property tax due to the issue; Corpn. attributes the problem to possible omissions during the data migration process to the new software

title: Quantum Valley initiative of Andhra Pradesh will be a boon for engineering students, says Centurion University vice-president
content: ‘The university has partnered with several leading software firms and industries to provide skill-based education and domain-specific placement opportunities for nearly 2,000 students’

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu to visit New Delhi on July 15, 16
content: On agenda are meetings with several Union Ministers, a business conference hosted by the CII, and P.V. Narasimha Rao Memorial event

title: Congress seeks Prime Minister Modi’s intervention to save nurse Nimisha Priya
content: Party leader Venugopal says he has requested the PM to use all diplomatic measures to get the nurse off death row

title: Kerala example of ‘welfare magnet State’, says paper presented at ILO meet
content: Rapid urbanisation, demographic shifts and falling fertility rates drive Kerala’s appeal among inter-State migrants

title: Congress targets Bihar Minister over fake medicine conviction
content: Supriya Shrinate demands resignation of BJP’s Jivesh Mishra; raises concerns over accountability and public health

title: Students being made to ‘record’ their menstrual cycle data shocks people
content: It is part of ‘Mission Suraksha’ launched apparently following rising concerns over child marriages and teenage pregnancies

title: Cop found dead; family alleges foul play
content: Jaison Alex, a Circle Inspector with the Telecommunication department of the police, was found hanging at his home in Pullannivila

title: KDA urges State govt. to fill all 55,000 vacancies in schools
content: Rani Channamma University should collaborate with Kannada Deelopment Authority, says Purushottam Bilimale

title: Otter threat lurks on Kottayam’s riverbanks
content: As number of otter bite incidents go up, residents seek urgent steps to control their population. Also, fish farmers report huge losses as otters, attacking in groups, consume large quantities of fish. Poaching otter a punishable offense the animal is classified as a “vulnerable” species on the IUCN Red List

title: Investors’ meet on cards to promote Kinfra projects in Kozhikode
content: Proposal mooted at a State-level meeting in Thiruvananthapuram attended by Industries and Public Works Ministers

title: BMTC rolls out ‘OnBoard’ assistive device for visually impaired city bus commuters
content: Officials say the device is aimed at eliminating the need for visually impaired individuals to rely on bystanders at bus stops, thus reducing mental stress and improving self-confidence

title: Outrage over foot worship at schools in Kasaragod, Kannur
content: Education Minister, child rights panel seek reports.  Minister calls for report from Director of General Education and condemns the practice as undemocratic and against the spirit of modern education

title: Chirag Paswan raises concern over rising crime in Bihar, questions police accountability
content: Union Minister and LJP (Ram Vilas) chief says law and order deteriorating; faces criticism from NDA allies over remarks

title: 'I love a pretty shoe': Paige Bueckers says Azzi Fudd helps her pick game sneakers
content: Paige Bueckers has 11 points in the Wings' 102-72 loss to the Phoenix Mercury . she wore the Devin Booker signature shoe . her former teammate Azzi Fudd helps her pick out her game-day sneakers .

title: Mahomes in Round 11? WRs, RBs prioritized in 8-team mock draft
content: some fantasy football mock drafts are for leagues with 10 or 12 teams . fewer starting slots than in larger leagues, there are notable differences in draft approach . most obvious comes at quarterback, where only five were selected in the first 10 rounds .

title: Who dropped out of the top 10? Players eyeing a bounce-back at TE, RB and Edge
content: sportsmail's survey of the top 10 players at every position is unveiled . we'll collect those names here as the top-10 for each position is revealed . more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position, and in many cases all positions .

title: Cooper Flagg's first game: Top plays, takeaways and future impact
content: Cooper Flagg made his highly anticipated debut for the Dallas Mavericks on Thursday . the matchup boasted the highest average ticket price for a summer league game since Victor Wembanyama's debut . he finished with 10 points, 6 rebounds and 4 assists as Dallas bested los Angeles .

title: Katie Taylor fought the right fight at the right time against Amanda Serrano
content: women's boxing may not have the stage it had on Netflix in front of millions of viewers . she fought serrano's fight for the first 20 rounds of their trilogy . her coach and promoter advised her the first two times to not make the fights more difficult .

title: 💍 Cavs' Mitchell engaged to Grammy winner
content: the Cleveland Cavaliers guard revealed in a post on twitter that he popped the question . he shared a photo of the two together, followed by a video of him getting down on one knee to ask Jones to marry him with her song "You" rumors that the couple were dating started circulating in 2024 .

title: Inside the cockpit: ‘Why did you cut off ...?’ What was the last conversation between AI 171 pilots
